Comments_List: Interesting discussions related to scientific ethics and regulatory institutions.
I thought it was an engaging course. I really enjoyed learning about research ethics and thought the class provided a lot of good resources to learn them.

Strengths were getting to consider research from an ethical/philosophical point of view, which is something rarely discussed in STEM classes. Weaknesses were that it was largely passive listening to information or being called on, rather than any true discussion between students.

Strengths - well organized, safe space for discussing ethics
Cons - no small group discussions

This class is basically an addendum to research for credit within the chemistry major. While the topics discussed were important, the research component was much more significant in terms of time and intellectual challenge.
Yes, I think doing this course made me a better chemist.
